alert.note: Alert for Miami (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 12:01PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Miami, Cass, northwestern Henry, northwestern Bates, northwestern Pettis, western Howard, Saline, southern Lafayette, southeastern Jackson and Johnson Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1201 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow from nearby thunderstorms along a line extending from near Waverly to Drexel. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Marshall, Harrisonville, Pleasant Hill, Odessa, Higginsville, Peculiar, Louisburg, Butler, Knob Noster, Concordia, Holden, Adrian, Garden City, Sweet Springs, Whiteman Air Force Base, Archie, La Monte, Lone Jack and Drexel. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 38 and 82. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for central, north central and west central Missouri.
